title: How bad is it to burn incense near my PC? : r/NoStupidQuestions - Reddit
body: Mostly skin cells, bits of hair, dust mites that live off that, and random stuff you brought into the house such as dirt, sand, and outdoor pollution. So 25 percent bits of you, and 75 percent stuff that you are unavoidably going to add just by being around. Burning incense every now and then likely is not going to contribute much to that muck.
readable_content: - MaterialUpender (2020-09-09): Unless you smoke as much as a habitual smoker, the worst thing for your computer's internals is... YOU. Unless you are some kind of inanimate automaton, you produce up to 25 percent of the dust in your house. Yes. That grungy dusty kinda greasy grey gunk inside your computer when you clean it? Mostly skin cells, bits of hair, dust mites that live off that, and random stuff you brought into the house such as dirt, sand, and outdoor pollution. So 25 percent bits of you, and 75 percent stuff that you are unavoidably going to add just by being around. Burning incense every now and then likely is not going to contribute much to that muck. Of course if you are burning incense every hour of the day, I retract my assessment.
